column5: Saturday morning was cold, windy, and rainy sometimes, but after two weekends missed due to unforeseen circumstances, it did not matter  . Went with friend to my favored lake. At six am was still dark and pretty windy so we put boat adrift and started casting . By 7 am we’ve landed 3 pikes. Action slowed down little bit, so we’ve moved to the other part of the lake. More pikes and some bass. Then I’ve had my best hour ever  . It started with 27” pike, then chunky walleye, then my biggest to date LM bass ( 4.5 lb). On the end I’ve lost something BIG  in the weeds under the boat.  When I’ve pulled out J11 rapala from the water, two points of the back treble were almost straight. On the end we’ve landed 10 pikes ( lost four), five LM, walleye and this mystery  brute I did not have a chance to see.  Few pics
looks like a great day of fishing,congrats
Cool...you gotta love it when the bites just turns on like that!!!  Great report and pics...thanks for sharing!
Sounds like a greaty day! Nice pics and thanks for sharing!
Thats agreat day on the water !!!!!!!   great report & pics,you caught some nice sized fish for sure.  ..too bad about about the big one that got away.  ....cheers
Nice fish Keram, way to go.  Please tell me you got a fish pic for our team for the tourney  Joey
Nice fish!! Looks like you had a great day!
Wow nice wack of fish love the way you tricked out that boat.Congrats on the PB Largie.  Oh and nice pyjamas by the way  MTP
